AD_Naaber_Attacked.synopsis: AD for attacking Naaber from Carmen's cosmetics shop in Wyrm's Crossing. The AD is on a cooldown for a few seconds, so it cannot be spammed.
AD_Naaber_Attacked.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Go to Carmen's cosmetics shop ( S_WYR_FigaroSister_DEBUG_Point_5d7b1276-f516-49f2-b3ea-3564b25cd35c ) and enter to make Naaber follow you.- Lead him outside, somewhere unseen, and either shove or attack him (it is recommended to shove because that doesn't kill him usually).

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials.synopsis: Behaviour AD for Carmen - Carmen first looks through fabrics and then moves to a mannequin to see which fabric would be most appropriate.
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use the debugbook to go to Carmen's cosmetics shop- Carmen will be doing this AD during her behaviour loop inside the shop.- When she is at the box of fabrics, she will do the left-side ADs.- After that, she will walk over to a mannequin and play this dialogue again, this time saying the right-side ADs.- The lines sequence goes from down to up - the left and right ADs are matched horizontally.

AD_Naaber_RiversideSpotted.synopsis: We re-encounter Naaber on the Chiontar riverside after we "accidentally" pushed him off the Wyrm's Crossing bridge into the river.
AD_Naaber_RiversideSpotted.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Either go to Carmen's Cosmetics shop, encounter Naaber and push him into the river, or use "oe Naaber_Chasm". The shop is near S_WYR_FigaroSister_DEBUG_Point_5d7b1276-f516-49f2-b3ea-3564b25cd35c- Find Naaber at S_WYR_FigaroSister_Naaber_Riverside_Point_e8cf2752-8e2e-4318-a3cf-cf985d7b43cd and get spotted by him.

Naaber_Dead.synopsis: Speak with Dead dialogue for Naaber. Unlike most characters, he will talk to his killer and ignore the "power of the spell waning" limit.
Naaber_Dead.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Go to Carmen's cosmetics shop ( S_WYR_FigaroSister_DEBUG_Point_5d7b1276-f516-49f2-b3ea-3564b25cd35c ) and enter to make Naaber follow you.- Lead him outside, somewhere unseen, and Ctrl+Shift+K kill him.- "addDebugSpell Target_SpeakWithDead_Test"- Cast the SwD spell on him.

Carmen.synopsis: Default dialogue with Carmen Pennygood, owner of a cosmetics shop in Wyrm's Crossing near Wyrm's Rock. Sister of Figaro "Facemaker" Pennygood, owner of a rival cosmetics shop in Baldur's Gate. They have a strained relationship.
Carmen.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Speak with Carmen: S_WYR_FigaroSister_Carmen_99c32d1b-838c-4db2-8150-d4112aedc636- To test the different branches, it is best to set or clear the associated flags in ReCon (SetGlobalOsirisFlag, SetCharacterOsirisFlag).

AD_Naaber_Attacked_0.speaker: Naaber
AD_Naaber_Attacked_0.text: Go for it! I believe in you!

AD_Naaber_Attacked_2.speaker: Naaber
AD_Naaber_Attacked_2.text: All right that one hurt a bit.

AD_Naaber_Attacked_3.speaker: Naaber
AD_Naaber_Attacked_3.text: Oh I see! This is a test! I love tests!

AD_Naaber_Attacked_4.speaker: Naaber
AD_Naaber_Attacked_4.text: Perhaps we should talk about this!

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_1.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_1.text: I'm sure have some suede lying around here.

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_4.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_4.text: Oof no, I don't think that'll work actually.

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_14.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_14.text: I'll just have to try it out and see.

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_8.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_8.text: Oh well done Carmen, that would be fantastic if you wanted to run this business at a loss.

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_12.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_12.text: Or maybe that will be too much? Too much.

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_9.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_9.text: Looks great, feels like hemp. No.

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_10.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_10.text: This one could work. For another season.

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_5.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_5.text: A sequinned adornment could bring a bit of a spark.

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_6.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_6.text: Moonshae fleece? Could be, could be...

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_7.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_7.text: How about some good old fashioned cotton?

AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_16.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
AD_Carmen_LookAtMaterials_16.text: Oooo, perhaps a touch of velvet.

AD_Naaber_RiversideSpotted_1.speaker: Naaber
AD_Naaber_RiversideSpotted_1.text: Water's mighty brisk today! Nice little impromptu dip there.

AD_Naaber_RiversideSpotted_3.speaker: Naaber
AD_Naaber_RiversideSpotted_3.text: Good job I'm a strong swimmer! No drowning for me! Haha!

Naaber_Dead_72.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_72.text: Son of... Niiber... son of... Nuuber...

Naaber_Dead_45.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_45.text: Sorry not... to have... met you... properly... when I... was... still alive...

Naaber_Dead_10.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_10.text: Oh the... conversations... we could... have had...

Naaber_Dead_11.speaker: Player
Naaber_Dead_11.text: What were you doing before you died?

Naaber_Dead_88.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_88.text: An adventurer... but I... couldn't... figure out... what... kind...

Naaber_Dead_49.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_49.text: Always... fancied myself... a bit of... a bard...

Naaber_Dead_18.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_18.text: But I... don't know... how to... play... an instrument...

Naaber_Dead_12.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_12.text: I guess... we'll never... find out... now...

Naaber_Dead_33.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_33.text: Shame... the stories... I could... have told...

Naaber_Dead_14.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_14.text: Alive... But now... that I'm... dead...

Naaber_Dead_29.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_29.text: I will... have... to... try... even... harder... to be... heard...

Naaber_Dead_32.speaker: Player
Naaber_Dead_32.text: What was your profession before you tried to be an adventurer?

Naaber_Dead_39.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_39.text: Once... I tried... to be... a shopkeeper...

Naaber_Dead_83.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_83.text: But... I never... made... enough... sales...

Naaber_Dead_4.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_4.text: I... had... so many... nice... conversations... with... the customers...

Naaber_Dead_38.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_38.text: I... told... them... everything... there was... to know... about... the... produce...

Naaber_Dead_17.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_17.text: And that's... how I realised... I wasn't... supposed... to be... a shopkeeper...

Naaber_Dead_82.speaker: Narrator
Naaber_Dead_82.text: *The spell's power wanes - but the spirit refuses to be silent.*

Naaber_Dead_89.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_89.text: I... regret... not... being... your... friend...

Naaber_Dead_26.speaker: Player
Naaber_Dead_26.text: Have you always been so talkative?

Naaber_Dead_70.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_70.text: My... father... learned... from his father... who learned... from his father...

Naaber_Dead_8.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_8.text: That... we... have... to be... persistent...

Naaber_Dead_71.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_71.text: He always... said... if at first... people don't... listen...

Naaber_Dead_87.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_87.text: Ha... ha... us... Noobers... sure do... like... to talk...

Naaber_Dead_43.speaker: Player
Naaber_Dead_43.text: Has anyone ever told you you're really annoying?

Naaber_Dead_50.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_50.text: But... I... try not... to... let it... get... to me...

Naaber_Dead_65.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_65.text: I... don't... understand... why... everyone... else... isn't... the same... way...

Naaber_Dead_63.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_63.text: Isn't it... lovely... to talk... to someone...?

Naaber_Dead_58.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_58.text: Did... I... ever... tell... you... about... that... time... I tried... to be... a chef?

Naaber_Dead_44.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_44.text: It... was... three... years... ago... but... I... remember it... like... yesterday...

Naaber_Dead_90.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_90.text: First... I tried... to be... a... pastry... chef...

Naaber_Dead_24.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_24.text: Then... I... tried... to... specialise... in... fish...

Naaber_Dead_1.speaker: Narrator
Naaber_Dead_1.text: *Time passes. You can practically feel your hairs growing, and your eyes watering from trying to stay awake.*

Naaber_Dead_7.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_7.text: And... that's... how... I... realised... that... being a... chef... wasn't... for me...

Naaber_Dead_22.speaker: Player
Naaber_Dead_22.text: How do I make this stop?

Naaber_Dead_16.speaker: Narrator
Naaber_Dead_16.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Naaber_Dead_37.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_37.text: Don't... you... want... to... know... more...

Naaber_Dead_34.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_34.text: I have... so much... more... to tell... you...

Naaber_Dead_77.speaker: Narrator
Naaber_Dead_77.text: *His body longs to rest, but his spirit doesn't stop talking, even as he returns to what one can only hope are the deepest depths of the Hells.*

Naaber_Dead_74.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_Dead_74.text: Wait... we... have... only... just... started... talking...

Carmen_7.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_7.text: Welcome back to Carm's Garms, we've got clothes for your... arms? Um. What do you need?

Carmen_13.speaker: Player
Carmen_13.text: That patter was atrocious. Garms and arms? Really?

Carmen_17.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_17.text: I already told you - if patter's your main interest, go see my brother. My focus is good clothing for a good price.

Carmen_42.speaker: Player
Carmen_42.text: Patter still needs a bit of work. Maybe less rhyming.

Carmen_21.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_21.text: I... see you're wearing some of my brother's handiwork. It suits your colouring. If you're interested in something to complement the look, welcome to Carm's Garms!
Carmen_21.context: NodeContext: a bit sad, her usual distaste for her brother's handiwork gone (brother is dead), tries to rally herself with more cheer at the end

Carmen_22.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_22.text: Ahoy, stranger, thanks for stopping by Carm's Garms! I'm Carm - well, Carmen, hah. What can I do you for?
Carmen_22.context: NodeContext: she's nervous, a bit stammery, too quick to force a laugh

Carmen_9.speaker: Player
Carmen_9.text: Perhaps leave the taglines to the experts, hm? You haven't quite nailed that patter.

Carmen_3.speaker: Player
Carmen_3.text: You've not quite got the patter nailed yet, Carmen.

Carmen_18.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_18.text: If it's empty patter you want, get your clothes from my brother, Figaro.

Carmen_14.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_14.text: But if it's genuine quality, and genuine taste,  you're after - Carm's Garms has you covered.

Carmen_15.speaker: Player
Carmen_15.text: Let's take a look at your wares.

Carmen_36.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_36.text: Yes... Well. I suppose he'd have wanted someone to clothe you lot.
Carmen_36.context: NodeContext: If Carmen knows that her brother died, she will be a bit more absent-minded.

Carmen_30.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_30.text: Sounds good, get you something a bit... fresher than your current outfit.

Carmen_32.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_32.text: Cheers for that. If you... If you need clothes, you know where I am.
Carmen_32.context: NodeContext: If Carmen knows that her brother died, she will be a bit more absent-minded.

Carmen_44.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_44.text: Remember - Carm's Garms, here for all your fashion needs!

Carmen_37.speaker: Player
Carmen_37.text: Carmen? I think I met your brother, Figaro. He didn't speak highly of you.

Carmen_20.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_20.text: Well, allow me to return the favour. He's a pig and a bastard.

Carmen_40.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_40.text: Since Dad died he thinks he's cock of the bloody walk. That I should give up my shop and work for 'family business'. For him. Dick.

Carmen_45.speaker: Player
Carmen_45.text: Maybe Figaro wanted his sister close. You just lost your dad, after all.

Carmen_29.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_29.text: Maybe you should keep your nose out of where it doesn't bloody belong. Now, you want clothes or not?

Carmen_41.speaker: Player
Carmen_41.text: You're a lot less snooty than that other clothes seller, Figaro.

Carmen_33.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_33.text: Glad to hear the snootiness doesn't run in the family. Now, while I'd happily stand hear and shite talk my brother all day - I've clothes to sell.

Carmen_39.speaker: Player
Carmen_39.text: Your brother is in danger. I found his name on a serial killer's list.

Carmen_24.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_24.text: A killer? That's... gods. I've no love for my brother but that's extreme. He doesn't deserve that.

Carmen_46.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_46.text: Thanks for warning me. But it's him that needs warning. And he never listens to me.

Carmen_8.speaker: Player
Carmen_8.text: So you didn't get on with your brother?

Carmen_31.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_31.text: He was... difficult. Always thought I should come work for him in Dad's old shop.

Carmen_26.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_26.text: Thought me working on my own stuff was 'disrespectful'. But maybe he was just trying to keep me close after Dad... Who knows.

Carmen_11.speaker: Player
Carmen_11.text: So you don't get on with your brother?

Carmen_1.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_1.text: You wouldn't either, if you knew him like I did.

Carmen_28.speaker: Player
Carmen_28.text: I'm afraid your brother's been murdered.

Carmen_0.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_0.text: Murdered? ... Gods. He didn't deserve to die.

Carmen_47.speaker: Carmen Pennygood
Carmen_47.text: I... see you're wearing some of my brother's handiwork. If... If you're interested in something with a bit more life to it, welcome to Carm's Garms!
